Opens the link in the tab..win: Drag a link to a tab.

Returns the tab to its original position.win: Press Esc while dragging a tab.
Returns the tab to its original position.linux: Press Esc while dragging a tab.

Maximizes or minimizes the window..win: Double-click the blank area on the tab strip.
Maximizes or minimizes the window..linux: Double-click the blank area on the tab strip.

Opens the link in a new tab in the backg.mac: Press ⌘ and click a link. Or click a link with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).
Opens the link in a new tab in the backg.win: Press Ctrl and click a link. Or click a link with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).
Opens the link in a new tab in the backg.linux: Press Ctrl and click a link. Or click a link with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).

Switches to the previous tab..mac: Press ⌘-Option and the left arrow together.

Displays your browsing history in the ta.mac: Click and hold either the Back or Forward arrow in the browser toolbar.

Displays your browsing history in the ta.linux: Right-click, or click and hold either the Back or Forward arrow in the browser toolbar.

Goes to the previous page in your browsi.win: Press Backspace, or Alt and the left arrow together.

Opens the link in a new tab..win: Drag a link to a blank area on the tab strip.

Opens the tab in the existing window..mac: Drag a tab out of the tab strip and into an existing window.

Opens the tab in the existing window..linux: Drag a tab out of the tab strip and into an existing window.

Maximizes the window..mac: Press Shift while clicking the + button in the top left corner of the window.

Opens the link in a new tab and switches.mac: Press ⌘-Shift and click a link. Or press Shift and click a link with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).
Opens the link in a new tab and switches.win: Press Ctrl+Shift and click a link. Or press Shift and click a link with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).
Opens the link in a new tab and switches.linux: Press Ctrl+Shift and click a link. Or press Shift and click a link with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).

Goes to the next page in your browsing h.win: Press Shift+Backspace, or Alt and the right arrow together.
Goes to the next page in your browsing h.linux: Press Alt and the right arrow together.

Switches to the next tab..mac: Press ⌘-Option and the right arrow together.

Opens the button destination in a new ta.win: Press Ctrl and click either the Back arrow, Forward arrow, or Go button in the toolbar. Or click either button with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).
Opens the button destination in a new ta.linux: Click either the Back arrow, Forward arrow, or Go button in the toolbar with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).

Downloads the target of the link..mac: Press Option and click a link.
Downloads the target of the link..win: Press Alt and click a link.
Downloads the target of the link..linux: Press Alt and click a link.

Makes everything on the page smaller..win: Ctrl and -, or press Ctrl and scroll your mousewheel down.
Makes everything on the page smaller..linux: Ctrl and -, or press Ctrl and scroll your mousewheel down.

Saves the link as a bookmark..mac: Drag a link to the bookmarks bar.

Saves the link as a bookmark..linux: Drag a link to bookmarks bar

Scrolls horizontally on the page..win: Press Shift and scroll your mousewheel.

Activates auto-scrolling. As you move yo.win: Click the middle mouse button (or mousewheel).

Enlarges everything on the page..win: Ctrl and +, or press Ctrl and scroll your mousewheel up.
Enlarges everything on the page..linux: Ctrl and +, or press Ctrl and scroll your mousewheel up.

Opens the URL in a new tab..win: Type a URL, then press Alt+Enter.

Highlights the next key term in the addr.mac: Press Shift-Option and the right arrow together.

Selects the previous or next entry in th.mac: Press Page Up or Page Down in the addess bar menu.

Opens the entry in a new tab in the back.linux: Click an entry in the address bar drop-down menu with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).

Selects the first or last entry in the d.win: Press Page Up or Page Down when the address bar drop-down menu is visible.

Moves your cursor to the preceding key t.mac: Press Option and the left arrow together.

Moves your cursor to the preceding key t.linux: Press Ctrl+Shift and the left arrow together.

Highlights the preceding key term in the.mac: Press Shift-Option and the left arrow together.

Deletes the entry from your browsing his.linux: Select an entry in the address bar drop-down menu with your keyboard arrows, then press Shift+Delete.
